title: Bug: foundryup has no versioning nor depreciation notices.
body: ### Component Foundryup ### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date? - [ ] Foundry - [X] Foundryup ### What version of Foundry are you on? _No response_ ### What command(s) is the bug in? _No response_ ### Operating System None ### Describe the bug # Enable robust and secure CI/CD processes by creating a separate `foundryup` Changes like this: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/5361 where `-L` is removed should be communicated to the user, maybe adding a depreciation notice first. Example solution: ## Change release and linkage of the new script This workflow runs and creates the foundryup file as a release asset, versus the current fetching of the script via `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/`. Arguably this is preferable as it's both a known release version as opposed to the current way of just grabbing the latest file over raw.githubusercontent.com Example > Note that the asset `v-2023-07-17` is in fact just a `.tar.gz` archive ```console curl -sSL https://github.com/sambacha/foundryup-tests/releases/download/tag-2023-07-17/v-2023-07-17 | tar -v -C $HOME/ -xz x foundryup/ x foundryup/install x foundryup/.gitkeep ``` Inspecting `refs/heads/master` we can see the hash ```bash $ git ls-remote https://github.com/sambacha/foundryup-tests master -h ✔︎ 9c5b8d411c456212957efbf4fcaf8002e78d15bc refs/heads/master x 74f3b97370de8748651421a95a4e3e05d45239fb refs/tags/master ``` That hash matches the value defined in `SCRIPT_COMMIT_SHA` ```bash # runs with Makefile to generate hash on CI # shellcheck disable=SC2034 SCRIPT_COMMIT_SHA="9c5b8d411c456212957efbf4fcaf8002e78d15bc" ```
